result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander Figueroa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $600.00 payable to Jean W.; payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.
UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE SENTENCE. COURT WILL GRANT EXPUNGEMENT IF DEFENDANT SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETES SENTENCE AND HAS NO FURTHER VIOLATIONS OF THE LAW, UPON SUBMISSION OF MOTION.

- Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
- Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
- Complete any and all other counseling deemed appropriate.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- No Contact with the victim(s) JEAN W. Any violation may result in additional charges.
- Write letter of apology to the victim.
- Obtain and maintain employment or school.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alexander Figueroa in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jennifer Uppena appeared on behalf of the DOC.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Agent Uppena advised that the Defendant has been compliant after the Sanction time was served.  Defense advised that Defendant is now in compliance with the conditions of Probation.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Agent Uppena advised that matter does NOT need a future Review date at this time.  Agent Uppena to contact the Clerk if any further need arises.
By agreement of the Parties,  matter is ADJOURNED to 07-18-2016 at 03:00 pm.  sdg

Defendant Alexander Figueroa in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Alexander Figueroa in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agent Jennifer Uppena appeared on behalf of the DOC.  Alberto F appeared on behalf of the Defendant.

Defendant is not in compliance with the Conditions of Probation set at Sentencing.  Defense advised that Defendant is running the risk of being REVOKED.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  DOC Agent advised that given the Defendant's age that the DOC and herself as Agent are still willing to work with the Defendant.  Defense requested that another Probation review be set.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO DEFENDANT TO SERVE SEVENTEEN (17) DAYS AS SANCTION.  NO GOOD TIME TO APPLY.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
DOC.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Alexander Figueroa in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also present is DOC Agent Jennifer Uppena.  sdg

State advised that the DOC is requesting a FIVE (5) DAY Sanction at this time.  Defense advised that Defendant IS testing negative AND has completed the Letter of Apology AND paid his Assessment fee.  Defense advised that Defendant is missing appointments with the Agent AND is NOT paying towards Restitution.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant advised that the money that was supposed to be going towards Restitution he had loaned to his Sister for rent.  Agent Uppena advised the Court that the Defendant did NOT elect to participate in the GED program that the Agent has suggested.  Defendant advised that he was going to take his transcripts to MATC in order to enroll in the GED program.  Court ordered Defendant to participate in the program that Agent Uppena suggested.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO SERVE FIVE (5) DAYS as Sanction.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
DOC.  Filed, sdg.
DOC agent is unavailable 04-18-2016.  Matter adjourned to 04-19-2016 at 01:30 pm for Review.  sdg
DOC agent is unavailable 04-04-2016.  Matter adjourned to 04-18-2016 at 01:30 pm for Review.  sdg

Defendant Alexander Figueroa in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by: ALBERTO F.

Defendant sentenced to serve NINETY (90) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for THREE (3) days time served.  Huber privileges for work and school.  No electronic monitoring.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of ONE (1) YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

* Court ordered the defendant to serve THIRTY (30) DAYS in the House of Correction.  STAYED.  To be used at agent's discretion. FIVE (5) DAYS TO BE SERVED FORTHWITH.  NO HUBER OR ELECTRONIC MONITORING.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* No contact with the victim(s) JEAN W.  Any violation may result in additional charges.
* Write letter of apology to the Victim.
* Obtain and maintain employment or school.
* Restitution payable to JEAN W. for SIX HUNDRED DOLLARS ($600.00) or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Matter is adjourned for SIXTY (60 DAYS to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alexander Figueroa in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $300.00 PR.

Defendant Alexander Figueroa in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State will not be moving to revoke the DPA at this time.  Defense requests an adjournment until after 01-01-2016.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant to write a plan for the future.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 300.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

No appearances by Defense or Defendant.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  $300.00 PR BOND IS FORFEITED.
JusticePoint DPA Non-compliance Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Alexander Figueroa in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense reports that Defendant will be going to JusticePoint directly after this hearing.  Court admonishes Defendant.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Alexander Figueroa in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point DPA Progress Report. Filed, sdg.
Recevied and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Alexander Figueroa in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

Defendant has all negative tests, made all contacts, and is working full time. Defendant to complete community service, pay restitution, and provide verification of employment to Justice Point.   All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date. Case adjourned to branch 33 for a Final Review Hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms and no applying for conceal and carry permit.

Defendant Alexander Figueroa in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 4/6/15 @ 10:00am
